The values in the matrix correspond to the genetic distances between pairs of taxa.</span></p> <p><span style='font-size: large;'>For example, the distance between <span style="color: #661a00;"><b>taxon Ashen</b></span> and <span style="color: #664b00;"><b>taxon Chimera</b></span> is <b>60</b>. Distances are symmetric, meaning that both the distance between <span style="color: #664b00;"><b>taxon Chimera</b></span> and <span style="color: #803100;"><b>taxon Dibblet</b></span> is <b>60</b> and the distance between <span style="color: #803100;"><b>taxon Dibblet</b></span> and <span style="color: #664b00;"><b>taxon Chimera</b></span> is <b>60</b>.</span></p><p><span style='font-size: large;'>Using this distance matrix, determine the most appropriate gene tree that accurately reflects the relationships and distances between these taxa.</span></p>	A. <table style="border-collapse: collapse; The values in the matrix correspond to the genetic distances between pairs of taxa.</span></p> <p><span style='font-size: large;'>For example, the distance between <span style="color: #664b00;"><b>taxon Chimera</b></span> and <span style="color: #803100;"><b>taxon Dibblet</b></span> is <b>44</b>. The values in the matrix correspond to the genetic distances between pairs of taxa.</span></p> <p><span style='font-size: large;'>For example, the distance between <span style="color: #661a00;"><b>taxon Ashen</b></span> and <span style="color: #664b00;"><b>taxon Chimera</b></span> is <b>8</b>. The values in the matrix correspond to the genetic distances between pairs of taxa.</span></p> <p><span style='font-size: large;'>For example, the distance between <span style="color: #001a66;"><b>taxon Bellen</b></span> and <span style="color: #006600;"><b>taxon Hydra</b></span> is <b>8</b>. Distances are symmetric, meaning that both the distance between <span style="color: #006600;"><b>taxon Hydra</b></span> and <span style="color: #424d57;"><b>taxon Kraken</b></span> is <b>40</b> and the distance between <span style="color: #424d57;"><b>taxon Kraken</b></span> and <span style="color: #006600;"><b>taxon Hydra</b></span> is <b>40</b>.</span></p><p><span style='font-size: large;'>Using this distance matrix, determine the most appropriate gene tree that accurately reflects the relationships and distances between these taxa.</span></p>	A. <table style="border-collapse: collapse; The values in the matrix correspond to the genetic distances between pairs of taxa.</span></p> <p><span style='font-size: large;'>For example, the distance between <span style="color: #003f66;"><b>taxon Elwet</b></span> and <span style="color: #660000;"><b>taxon Faylen</b></span> is <b>34</b>. Distances are symmetric, meaning that both the distance between <span style="color: #660000;"><b>taxon Faylen</b></span> and <span style="color: #49361d;"><b>taxon Jackalope</b></span> is <b>36</b> and the distance between <span style="color: #49361d;"><b>taxon Jackalope</b></span> and <span style="color: #660000;"><b>taxon Faylen</b></span> is <b>36</b>.</span></p><p><span style='font-size: large;'>Using this distance matrix, determine the most appropriate gene tree that accurately reflects the relationships and distances between these taxa.</span></p>	A. <table style="border-collapse: collapse; The values in the matrix correspond to the genetic distances between pairs of taxa.</span></p> <p><span style='font-size: large;'>For example, the distance between <span style="color: #803100;"><b>taxon Dibblet</b></span> and <span style="color: #003f66;"><b>taxon Elwet</b></span> is <b>30</b>.
